sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
By the King. A proclamation for the surveying and marking of iron, and survey of vvoods to bee used in the making thereof. England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I) Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.
3, [1] sheets.
by Robert Barker, printer to the Kings most excellent Majestie: and by the assignes of John Bill, [Imprinted at London : 1637]
Caption title. Dated at end: ... Oatlands, the nine and twentieth day of July, in the thirteenth yeere of Our reign. Imprint from colophon. Arms 24; Steele notation: and ed 2) re- 3) same 4) is, for. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

by Robert Barker, printer to the Kings most excellent Majestie: and by the assignes of John Bill, [Imprinted at London : 1637]
Caption title. Dated at end: ... Oatlands, the nine and twentieth day of July, in the thirteenth yeere of Our reign. Imprint from colophon. Arms 24; Steele notation: and ed 2) re- 3) same 4) is, for. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
